intro: Grindelia tricuspis, commonly known as the three-lobed gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are aromatic and have a distinctive, bitter taste. Grindelia tricuspis is known for its resilience to drought and its ability to thrive in disturbed environments.
